required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Connect® MM- The Multiple Myeloma Disease Registry
clinical_study.official_title: Connect® MM- The Multiple Myeloma Disease Registry

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the Connect® MM Registry is to explore the natural history and real world management of patients with newly diagnosed symptomatic multiple myeloma (MM) and provide unique insights into the management of MM and the impact of this hematologic disorder on patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Identify and summarize patterns in therapeutic regimens
primary_outcome.description: Describe practice patterns of common first-line treatment regimens and subsequent therapeutic strategies in patients newly diagnosed with symptomatic MM in the community and academic setting

primary_outcome.measure: Identify and summarize patterns in therapeutic regimens and patient outcomes
primary_outcome.description: Provide insight into treatment regimens and therapy sequence in clinical practice as they relate to clinical outcomes (response, overall survival, progression-free survival) in patients newly diagnosed with symptomatic MM

secondary_outcome.description: Describe any differences in effectiveness associated with different treatment regimens, including common first-line regimens, subsequent therapeutic strategies and regional effects (such as proximity of academic centers) in patients newly diagnosed with symptomatic MM

secondary_outcome.measure: Summarize health-related quality of life (HRQoL) relation to treatment regimens/sequence and clinical outcomes
secondary_outcome.description: Describe the health-related quality of life (HRQoL) of patients newly diagnosed with symptomatic MM, and to explore the association with HRQoL of treatment regimens/sequence and clinical outcomes

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group One: Patients enrolled between Sep2009 and Nov2011
arm_group.description: Newly diagnosed multiple myeloma patients enrolled between Sep 2009 and Nov 2011.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group Two: Patients enrolled between Dec2012 and mid-2016
arm_group.description: Newly diagnosed multiple myeloma patients enrolled between Dec 2012 and mid-2016

study_pop.textblock: Patients with newly diagnosed multiple myeloma and being treated in community or academic settings in the United States

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Newly diagnosed with symptomatic MM within 2 months of enrollment in Connect®MM registry
- Age ≥18 years
- Willing and able to provide signed informed consent
- Agrees to complete patient assessment questionnaires either alone or with minimal assistance from caregivers and/or trained site personnel
Exclusion Criteria:
- None

Connect MM Registry: The Importance of Establishing Baseline Disease Characteristics. Clin Lymphoma Myeloma Leuk. 2015 Jun;15(6):368-76. doi: 10.1016/j.clml.2014.12.002. Epub 2014 Dec 11.

Rifkin RM, Abonour R, Shah JJ, Mehta J, Narang M, Terebelo H, Gasparetto C, Toomey K, Hardin JW, Lu JJ, Kenvin L, Srinivasan S, Knight R, Nagarwala Y, Durie BG. Connect MM® - the Multiple Myeloma Disease Registry: incidence of second primary malignancies in patients treated with lenalidomide. Leuk Lymphoma. 2016 Sep;57(9):2228-31. doi: 10.3109/10428194.2015.1132419. Epub 2016 Jan 13.

Terebelo H, Srinivasan S, Narang M, Abonour R, Gasparetto C, Toomey K, Hardin JW, Larkins G, Kitali A, Rifkin RM, Shah JJ. Recognition of early mortality in multiple myeloma by a prediction matrix. Am J Hematol. 2017 Sep;92(9):915-923. doi: 10.1002/ajh.24796. Epub 2017 Jul 19.

Shah JJ, Abonour R, Gasparetto C, Hardin JW, Toomey K, Narang M, Srinivasan S, Kitali A, Zafar F, Flick ED, Rifkin RM. Analysis of Common Eligibility Criteria of Randomized Controlled Trials in Newly Diagnosed Multiple Myeloma Patients and Extrapolating Outcomes. Clin Lymphoma Myeloma Leuk. 2017 Sep;17(9):575-583.e2. doi: 10.1016/j.clml.2017.06.013. Epub 2017 Jun 17.
